website_summaries.verdict: Desirable price point per GB of storage for a convenient external SSD model.
pros: Available in storage capacities between 250 GB and 2 TB
Has a lower price point per GB than some other SSD options
Gives you a read-write speed up to 540 MB per second, which is above average for an external drive
cons: Doesn't seem to offer the longevity of some other types of SSDs

website_summaries.verdict: Full metal design that gives this external SSD a bit of toughness that outperforms many other models.
pros: Available in storage configurations ranging from 250 GB to 2 TB
Includes maximum read/write speeds of 540 Mbps
Gives the option of password protection and high-level data encryption
Ships with the USB cables you'll need for operation
cons: A little pricier per GB than some others
Connection with some computers can be spotty

customer_reviews.title: Not a Samsung T-5 - Confirmed by Samsung
customer_reviews.text: 500 GB external hard drive was delivered with 87 MB of space. Called Samsung support and the serial number confirmed that this is not a Samsung product. I don't know what third party Amazon bought this product from but they should be investigated immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Simon

customer_reviews.title: I would not buy this if I were you...
customer_reviews.text: I spent a lot of time researching the best one to buy. The Samsung Portable SSD T5 crashed 3 days after I received it...lost 378GB of photos and docs. All I did was upload my photos and docs and 3 days later everything was gone. This product was treated with TLC once I received it...now I am crushed from losing everything. I highly recommend that you make a different choice and not purchase this item.
customer_reviews.author: Andréa

customer_reviews.title: If you're planning on using this for a Mac, ...
customer_reviews.text: If you're planning on using this for a Mac, erase and reformat. It's compact and lightweight. The transfer speed is also faster than I expected. I will by upgrading to 1TB (or higher) strictly for video soon.
customer_reviews.author: @AlibiRanch

customer_reviews.title: Utterly Amazed
customer_reviews.text: I'm a music producer, so when it comes to storage and expedience, I try to find something that makes sense and doesn't break the bank. A friend of mine suggested this product to store my samples externally. When he told me about this, and when I was placing the order, I was just thinking that it will be just a tiny boost in loading times for the samples, but when I started using it in projects, it blew my mind right out of the water completely. When they say it's fast, they mean it's fast. Worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Izzie G

customer_reviews.title: Amazon sells fake SSDs
customer_reviews.text: Another fake item purchased directly from Amazon. I've had fake Gillette razors, fake flash drives, and now a fake SSD, all sold and shipped by Amazon. They seem to have lost control of their supply chain.
customer_reviews.author: Pen_Name

customer_reviews.title: Extremely slow on USB 3.0
customer_reviews.text: Extremely slow on USB 3.0. Writing a 20GB file only does so at 24MB per second. If anyone has any tips that will speed this up I will update my review.
customer_reviews.author: Tom N

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work with my Samsung Laptop!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to back up my Samsung laptop. The Samsung Recovery software, running on my Samsung laptop, with the latest Windows version, could not find the connected Samsung T5 SSD. This is pretty hard to believe. I tried upgrading my recovery software, as well as making sure I had the latest T5 software...all to no avail. After several hours I decided this shouldn't be this hard and sent it back. Either I got a T5 lemon or Samsung's software engineers are the worst on the planet.
customer_reviews.author: cjm

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Take your business else ware. The software that runs the hard drive was erased. Samsung could easily let customers download the software but there is a "daily limit." I can't return it, so I have to go through my credit cards fraud department.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: The T5 is a very good SSD device
customer_reviews.text: The T5 is a very good SSD device. I would imagine that many are returned for the lack of knowledge on how to set it up properly. This reflects on the product rather than the true problem, the lack of complete user friendly instructions. This is sad because the unit is many times blamed when it shouldn't be.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Fast, Lightweight, Portable.  It's a Data Storage Dream
customer_reviews.text: Phenomenal little unit. Palm size. Blackmagic Disk Speed Test shows 420 Mbps Read and Write via USB 3.0 on a Mac mini late 2012 with 500Gb Samsung SSD and 16Gb RAM. Accidentally connected to USB 2.0. Boot time went from 18 seconds to 75, and Blackmagic showed 42 & 38 Mbps, so absolutely requires USB 3.0 connection. Runs cool. Apps launch extremely fast. Purchased for $149. No regrets. Would recommend to anyone looking for large expansion and quick read/write.
customer_reviews.author: S. Lamb

customer_reviews.title: Works as an iMac OS X boot drive (faster than the installed hard drive)
customer_reviews.text: This is now the boot drive for a 2015 iMac 3.0 GHz, it’s much faster than the installed 5200 rpm hard drive. When installing it, use the 3.0 USB plug, and the trick is to do an internet recovery to install OS X on an external drive. (I had issues at first when trying to do a retailer recovery, because all the files didn’t copy over. The fix is to do a internet recovery and download install files to the external drive, it then worked like a charm). There is less lag when opening programs and the computer is faster. Once installed, used files transfer to copy your old profile from the installed hard drive to the SSD.
customer_reviews.author: P. Ritz

customer_reviews.title: Return item!
customer_reviews.text: It does no function or it is damaged . It doesn't have the memory it says!! I would like to return it and have a complete refund on it. thank you
customer_reviews.author: Cliente Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Speed Nirvana.
customer_reviews.text: Using this portable SSD in conjunction with an onboard SSD in my laptop is like speed nirvana. I can do file backups and disc image backups in such little time that it encourages frequent use, which is wise. To facilitate my backups I use the free AOMEI backup tool downloaded online. I believe my very fast backups are the result of two (2) SSD's working together. If you have a typical mechanical hard drive in your computer then you probably can still expect good performance but perhaps not as fast. Also, this Samsung T5 is very small and lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: RICKVOO

customer_reviews.title: Nice SSD and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I like really like this SSD so far and it looks cool too. It was easy to set up and use on my first PC (desktop). Then I tried it on my laptop and after entering the password it worked just fine. I downloaded about 300GB of home videos and pictures and it was pretty quick. Then I went to an older 3rd PC and found out this does not work with older operating systems (XP). I am no expert but that is what the error message was telling me. Not that big of a deal since I am getting rid of that PC but I wanted to download all the music first and that was not possible using this.
customer_reviews.author: GC

customer_reviews.title: FOREWARNED is FOREARMED
customer_reviews.text: This SSD arrived with an expired certificate but despite my computer warning me I continued to install anyway. I then noticed my computer was running slowly and the mail program was running even though it had not been when I started installing the SSD. There was an attempt to bulk mail from my mail account which I quickly shut down. I unplugged the SSD and unplugged from the internet. However, since I attempted to use this SSD, I have been logged out of all of my email and social media accounts on that computer. I'm not sure whether I was hacked or not. I suspect there is malicious software on the SSD. Yes, it was supposed to be new.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Interface is not true USB-C, it's USB 3.1, Gen 1 (5MB/s), not USB 3.1 Gen 2 (10MB/s). Otherwise, OK.
customer_reviews.author: Daddio

customer_reviews.title: Review on PS4 compatibility
customer_reviews.text: This review is on the compatibility with the PS4. The product itself is fine and simple enough to use; however if you are buying this in hopes of speeding up your load times, don't bother. Immediately upon plugging the drive to the PS4 (original 500gb), my controller started lagging and disconnecting. I thought it was a bit strange, but after transferring a game and trying to play it, the connectivity to the controller got worse. If you google this issue, it looks like it's been ongoing for years with any device using a 3.0 USB cable. Not wanting to play using a wired controller, I returned it the following day.
customer_reviews.author: Too Old for Games

customer_reviews.title: Cannot Clone Internal SSD drive with Acronis True image 2018
customer_reviews.text: Not compatible with Cloning Software? Acronis True Image 2018 software does not allow me to clone my HP Spectre laptop 500GB internal SSD to the Samsung T5. Very disappointed. Anyone knows why?
customer_reviews.author: CT

customer_reviews.title: Carbon Copy Cloner users beware
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, I didn't read the Carbon Copy Cloner documentation concerning the T5 before purchasing it. The documentation warns of slow boot times for macOS. In my experience, the T5 wouldn't boot macOS 10.13 at all when formatted as APFS; when formatted using the older HFS+ it booted grudgingly; the boot process would hang with an error and you had to select it as the boot drive again, after which the computer would boot properly. Apple appears to have fixed the problem with OS 10.14.3 Mojave; after upgrading, I haven't experienced the hang, at least with HFS+ formatting. Aside from the boot issue, the drive has been fast and reliable, and its any-direction USB-C plug is convenient.
customer_reviews.author: R. Bush

customer_reviews.title: Faster than a speeding Roly-Poly, even with a Thunderbolt 3.1 Gen 2 computer
customer_reviews.text: Update: discovered the cable included with the device does not support the stated speeds that the device is capable of. Strange, but true. Original post: Not sure whats up with this. Tried it on a Lenovo laptop and iMac 4K (2019) with USB 3.1. Couldn't get speeds above 45 MB/s on either device using multiple cables and various formats (FAT/exFAT). Updated the SSD software, no change. The Samsung Magician Utility for Windows couldn't verify that this was an authenticate product. Used DiskMark (Mac) and Crystal Disk (Win) and received same speed results. Will be returning for another brand after one more test using a certified Thunderbolt 3 cable. Expecting improved results.
customer_reviews.author: Kaotic1

customer_reviews.title: Great - but don't let it sleep
customer_reviews.text: Everyone loves SSDs. Of course they are fast, durable & bumping doesn't bother them. This one is great too. I use it as the daily boot drive on 2012 Mac Mini. It feels faster than the stock fusion drive. It gets power from the single USB cable, plugs right into ordinary USB ports. The only downside is that to prevent crashing I had to disable computer sleep. That fixed the problem. No big deal, if you know.
customer_reviews.author: David Nathanson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for PS4/Xbox!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for some more storage on my PS4 and this thing is absolutely amazing. If your games are taking ages to load on console, definitely consider getting one of these. It loads my games literally 3-5 times faster than the normal hard drive on the PS4, and I don’t even have a PS4 pro. Was easy to format to the PS4 and didn’t even take that long to transfer some games onto it. Highly recommended to anyone who has been looking to extend their storage on console.
customer_reviews.author: Blake Swihart

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: The cord constantly disconnects from my note 8 making it impossible to use. Since they are both samsung, this is just poor quality control. I do like the idea of solid state and it is metal do outside construction is nice
customer_reviews.author: B. Robert Young

customer_reviews.title: Great product, but it feels cheap.
customer_reviews.text: This product is great. It's durable, small, and has large capacities while still being blazing fast. My only issue with it is how it FEELS. While it's definitely durable, the end caps feel like really cheap plastic that isn't held in place amazingly. It doesn't feel like one solid item, but like several glued together. If you tap on the shell, you can hear the clicking the of metal hitting the chips inside of it. It feels durable but not solid. I would still absolutely recommend this product though, especially if the speed is what you really need.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Schnabel

customer_reviews.title: Connector to the USB3 tip defective
customer_reviews.text: It is such a fast drive. But I must have gotten a lemon. A tiny bump to the SSD, and it gets disconnected even though the drive is connected. I just missed the return window. :-( UPDATE: I just called Samsung. The best the customer support for me is to ship the SSD back to Samsung and have them ship one back. The turn around time is 5-7 business days. I am very displeased with it. In the meantime I have to erase the drive and lose my storage space. It is only a $90+ item, but it can't ship out something for me to transfer my data over. This is the last time I want to buy from Samsung.
customer_reviews.author: AstuteBuyer

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with Mac OS 10.15
customer_reviews.text: SSD not recognized by Mac OS 10.15. The T5 cannot be accessed after OS Catalina was downloaded. Still waiting for Samsung to come up with a software fix. May 2020. Due to the lockdown due to the corona virus I check the Samsung website for updates and there was an update for Mac OS 10.15 and after downloading, the T5 now works as advertised. I am happy with the fast loading of the T5 and have changed my rating to 5 Stars.
customer_reviews.author: Reginald Oka

customer_reviews.title: Used for an iMac.
customer_reviews.text: I have a nice iMac with great specs except they put in a 5400 HD???? so its the bottleneck of the system. My model is hard to take apart to swap out the internal HD, but I found that many just use the T5 and set it up so its the boot drive. I did this using Super Duper app to clone my internal to this, so 100% identical and waaaaaaaaaayy faster. I means makes it almost like a different computer, it is so noticeably faster. Now I use the internal for storage and media files and backups.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Mac Users! Samsung needs to ship an empty drive without the 44 MB security file!
customer_reviews.text: This drive will load osMac High Sierra 10.13.6 just fine but don't try to format to APFS (Apple File System) or Mojave later on as I did. The drive turned into a brick except for the embedded 44 MB security file which is all Mac Disk Utility will now recognize. Mojave disk utility evidently conceives the 44 MB file as unremovable malware and won't go any further.. Without a custom drive utility to force wipe the drive clean it will become usable with Mac APFS formats.
customer_reviews.author: A to Z

customer_reviews.title: Great way to speed up an iMac with a 5,400 RPM HDD
customer_reviews.text: After a little research, I decided to purchase the T5 to speed up our reliable, but slow, 2014 iMac. I installed it as the boot drive with a fresh install of Catalina. Holy cow, what a difference! It's like a completely different machine. Plug and play, seriously if you're in the same situation, don't hesitate!
customer_reviews.author: Super J

customer_reviews.title: SSD Software Does Not work with Mac OS Catalina
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Very small and light. Excellent for size/weight for portability. Cons: While my MacBook recognizes the drive and can presumably store files on it, the SSD (security) software does not recognize the drive so you can't password-protect the drive. Basically makes it a sexy HOME ONLY drive. Doing some research there has been issues with SSD software on Mac OS Catalina (Oct 2019) since it's release and Samsung STILL doesn't have a fix. Not good. I will be returning this product. Customer Service was great. Understood the issue and immediately offered to provided shipping label for me to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: Samsung continues the T series of portable SSD's with another solid product.
customer_reviews.text: Unbelievable writing speeds when using USB-C to USB-C, paid around 75 dollars for the 500GB model which seemed like a great price in 2018. It's a really solid product, just be warned though, avoid installing the software they mention for MAC or you'll be running commands in the console to remove the obscure files samsung stealth installs in your mac. If you need to upgrade the firmware, use a windows based PC. I knocked a star out of 5 because this has happened since the release of the T1 drive and here we are in version T5 and the same thing still exists.
customer_reviews.author: Pondo

customer_reviews.title: Very light, very fast
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to install the Catalina beta of OS X on a separate drive. It's very well suited for that. It's fast and comes with a cable that allows plugging it into the thunderbolt port rather than taking up a USB slot (though it includes a cable for that as well). One tip if you want to do this yourself: You'll need to make it a bootable drive. In disk utility, be sure to select Show All Devices in the View menu. Otherwise you're not getting to the root of the disk to be able to format it with a GUID partition map. This will also allow you to choose APFS.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Magoo

customer_reviews.title: Bouncy data transfer speeds, disconnected randomly during Shadowplay
customer_reviews.text: I got this because it was cheaper than an internal 500gb 860 Evo, and planned to primarily use it for recording gameplay vids via shadowplay. For whatever reason the drive would disconnect randomly during some recordings, again, completely randomly. Sometimes I could record for 20 minutes totally fine, other times videos wouldn't even make it two minutes. No clue why. I got some use out of my 3.1 v2 usb port for a while though, which was nice. Ah well. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Vince G.

customer_reviews.title: After 4 months - dead
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely loved this device until it decided, one day, to simply go dead. I suspect the C port is the culprit but I may never know. Also, it was only plugged/unplugged less than a dozen times over the course of its usage so it hasn't been abused. Have tried multiple cables , two different PCs and one laptop - nothing. The online tech support guys are pleasant enough - but I still am disappointed in the short lifespan. Apparently, there are engineering and/or manufacturing quality control issues here ...
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. A little faster than HDD...lots faster than thumb drive
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 - 500gb Samsung to test. Sick of slow thumb drives. I tested with transferring 327mb files. Here are results of transfer: WD Elements HDD 1TB drive - 12 sec SanDisk Ultra USB thumb Drive - 29 sec Samsung 500 gb SDD - 9 sec An unknown 250GB SDD internal boot drive transfers same file to unknown 2TB internal HDD in about 1 second. So fast the transfer does not show on the screen. Hopefully the Samsung SDD's hold up. Have had a few other SDD's, 2 out of 4 were defective. I'd love to phase out the HDD if the SDD proves reliable. I have ancient HDD going back 15 years + that still work.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel D. Teoli Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Next gen level storage
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for almost 2 years and this thing is above and beyond the best I've ever experienced and the best out there for storage. It's portable and super fast. I bought the 500 gig version and never had problems. I use it with windows and my Xbox one. The password protection has to be switched off to use with my Xbox one, but I really don't mind. I love this thing and playback directly off of this is flawless. Glad I bought it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazoned out

customer_reviews.title: Not Compatible with MacOS 10.15.5 Catalina
customer_reviews.text: Used this drive just fine for about a year. Just updated my Mac's OS to 10.15.5 and there are suddenly no drivers available. I can't access my photos or any of my data on the drive. All of my work data and the last photos I took of my dog before he died are on this drive so like no big deal, right? I just can't do my job tomorrow, no biggie. I opened a ticket with Samsung and will update if/when I have a solution. Right now, I would advise that you DO NOT BUY THIS DRIVE.
customer_reviews.author: Molly C. Cichy

customer_reviews.title: A big loss
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to boot my iMac late 2013, because I didn’t want to open the iMac and change the internal drive. But this drive has been a huge disappointment. After cloning my macOS Mojave’s beaded iMac to this drive, after working about an hour or it freezes and restart. Sometimes I loose all my unsaved work. It has made me abandon my iMac for the Mac mini that I recently changed the internal drive with OWC. SSD
customer_reviews.author: Uhunmwangho Courage

customer_reviews.title: Versatile and Quick!!!
customer_reviews.text: Have used it to backup HP, Toshiba, Acer, Dell, and samsung computers and laptops. Also backed up my Note8 onto the T5. Recommend buying the hard case by Xanad for storage and protection of the device. The connections that come with it are good length and the velcro wraps also velcro into the lid of the xanad carrying case, again making it the best choice.
customer_reviews.author: Educator

customer_reviews.title: Makes my iMac much faster!
customer_reviews.text: Got a 2019 iMac for WFH at Costco for a great price - win! Included HDD was super slow - loss! Guess Apple still uses HDDs to reduce price, but performance suffers. Hooked up this external SSD (did not want to tear apart my iMac to install an internal SSD), setup the SSD as the boot drive (lots of YT videos), now the iMac works great - no spinning balls or lagging!
customer_reviews.author: HQ

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Time Machine backup drive for your Mac
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect Time Machine drive for your Mac. It is smaller, more durable and much faster than the old HDD. I have an older Mac and am using the USB-A cable. I can only imagine how much faster it would be with a newer USB-C port (both cables are included with the drive). Just ignore what is on the drive as shipped. 1) Plug it in. 2) Open Disk Utility and erase/reformat the drive. 3) Open Time Machine and select the drive.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: No brainer
customer_reviews.text: Simply perfect. These are my recording media for my bmpcc 4k. Makes so much more sense than any others out there. I record in film pro res. Never had a drop out. Then you just plug it into your puters usbc port and edit straight from the drives. Saves time and hdd space. Plus at 100 bux Its so reasonable I’ll just sell the drive to my clients If they want the option of having all their raw footage and pick up a new one. Update: I’ve been recording in blackmagic raw since it was released recently. 3:1 constant bitrate. Works perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: VII

customer_reviews.title: Fast and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I've used many different ways to back up my vast amount of photos, documents and so on. I feel that after all these years I've finally found "the perfect" backup. After I purchased this great 500GB unit I ended up loving it so much I went ahead and splurged on the even larger memory 1TD. It's the same dimensions however holds twice as much. In any event I highly recommend this Samsung external solid state drive. Two solid thumbs up.
customer_reviews.author: Vic M

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade for OG Xbox One
customer_reviews.text: This thing is working well. Don’t expect science and numbers from me. It’s incredibly small. Comes with usbC and regular usb cables. I got it to upgrade my Xbox one OG. Moved some games over to it and they load much faster. Specifically PUBg the world renders before I land. And GTAV doesn’t take 3 minutes to get ingame it take 20 seconds. Plus I have more space now for stuff. Solid product. Gonna get more for other digital storage needs.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: VERY slow
customer_reviews.text: I am only getting up to 40MB/second read and write speeds. I emailed support. They had me do a bunch of ridiculous things to prove it was slow. I did them. Then they told me to fill out a form for an RMA. I did that. I never got a response. I followed up. They said it had been too long and I would need to start the process again. I threw it in the trash. Too much work for something defective. I won't trust Samsung drives again.
customer_reviews.author: Brad D.

customer_reviews.title: Glad I chose Samsung over Sandisk's overgrown USB-stick
customer_reviews.text: I've always been a fan of Sandisk - but after reading all the complaints about how hot their high speed (100's of MB/s) usb drives performed and degraded over months of use, I'm glad I opted for the Samsung. I'm getting 308 MB/s writes and 380 MB/s reads (not crystal diskmark - actual windows read/write speeds). It's faster, and runs cooler than the sandisk alternative. I use Samsung SATA SSDs and NVME M.2 PCIE drives in my laptops and never lost data on one of the Samsung products, so this drive keeps up the good reputation.
customer_reviews.author: HMMWV

customer_reviews.title: Very small in size, but large storage capacity
customer_reviews.text: These portable SSD drives are not only fast, but very compact. It isn't as small as a thumb drive, but you're getting 500GB of storage in a device smaller than a pack of cards. These SSDs are great to 'set it and forget it' for back up purposes. Essentially, plug it in, enable your favorite backup software, and let it do its thing. The drives are reliable and I've yet to have any issues with it. True plug n play.
customer_reviews.author: DG

customer_reviews.title: As far as I know...
customer_reviews.text: As far as I know this is a very reliable drive. It may or not be as reliable as you want it to be. Thus is the dilemma. Everything would point to reliability... but all of sudden I maxed out this drive without any warning.... so then it became totally unusable to me. I'm sorry to have to enlighten all of you, but we are going BACK to PAPER. If you don't have documentation... you have nothing. Very difficult with video files I know... but video files were not what I was backing up on this drive.
customer_reviews.author: KKL Recommends

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended for Nvidia Shield
customer_reviews.text: Got this to use as adopted storage for my Nvidia Shield..When I was using a HDD usb 3.0 drive when entering setting and looking at my apps I would have to wait for my apps to load up so that I could change setting..With this drive my apps load up in literally a blink of the eye.I would recommend this drive to anyone who is looking for more storage on their Nvidia Shield.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, fast.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice, high-quality drive and it transfers data MUCH faster than my 7,200rpm drives. I have a special music program that takes 28gb of samples to run (I max out my 32gb of ram) but the library files are even larger. I had totally choked my internal drive so I decided to move everything off to this external one. While there is a bit of a drop in load times since I'm using an external (rather than internal SSD) drive, it's still very acceptable and I can load 28gb of samples in under a minute. Not bad! I'm pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Romanos

customer_reviews.title: Great Value and Support
customer_reviews.text: What's not to like in a 500G SSD? Tiny, fast, reliable. This is my 3rd T5. This time, under a newer MacOS, Disk Utility hid the volume structures from me and at first I couldn't obtain the full range of formatting options (including encryption, for which I would only use system software, not included 3rd party software...). Samsung tech support knew exactly what the trouble was even though it was not theirs but rather Apple's and mine. If you need 500G just get this.
customer_reviews.author: Bart Windrum

customer_reviews.title: Drive ejects improperly when Mac goes to sleep
customer_reviews.text: Every time my computer wakes up from sleep, I get an alert that the drive ejected improperly. Looking online, many people have this problem. Im using an iMac. Perhaps the computer is the problem? Applications using media on the drive also freak out when this happens. If you are using a mac, consider the nearly identical drive from SanDisk.
customer_reviews.author: Joel

customer_reviews.title: Fan-bloody-tastic...
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this SSD... bought it for my BMPCC 4K... but after testing the R/W speeds on my iMac I bought a second 1T version for my iMac and do all my editing on it before transferring to my main storage (an 8T Seagate hybrid)... can't rave about this too much... and perfect for shooting on the BMPCC 4K... leads than the cost of a CFast card with 5x the storage... and I can record in BMRAW or Prores Wonderful...
customer_reviews.author: PunaPhantom

customer_reviews.title: Not as fast as advertisements would lead to believe.
customer_reviews.text: Like the encryption solution. It gives an option for Mac users but doesn't seem to work. Speeds I got were much lower than advertised. (in mbs) Read | Write SeqQ32T1 422 433 4kQ32T1 144 151 Seq 404 403 4k 19.42 38.9 Ran tests a few times. Could have a lower quality item out of a batch. Hope your experience is better.
customer_reviews.author: Christian_

customer_reviews.title: Very Good for External Steam Library
customer_reviews.text: As the title says, using it for an external Steam library is practically flawless. Over USB 3.0 I've noticed virtually no difference in load times or other performance issues compared to my internal SSD (where space is limited). Overall I'm very impressed! Primary reason for this over a standard external HDD or flash drive is for the much higher random read/write speeds.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: I have two of the 500 GB size and both work well. If you password protect it, don't forget your password or your data will be lost and it will be useless. I password protected one for work and use the other one for backup. I am satisfied with mine and I recommend SSD over the older HD. Like all electronic devices, it will be replaced in a year by a better one. But this one will be useful as long as it works.
customer_reviews.author: Dieter R. Hauser

customer_reviews.title: OMG it's so fast!
customer_reviews.text: Night and day effect on my PS4 loading. I play a lot of Destiny and big and little loads are happening all the time. This just speeds up everything. The precious time saved adds up and the game just feels faster and better to play. With other games I expect that the faster loading times will be nice, but because you're going to menus and different planets so often in Destiny it really does change the game entirely. If you've got the means, go for it!
customer_reviews.author: Young Fraa

customer_reviews.title: Superfast and TINY - waiting to see if it lasts as long as the SSD my Macbook Air (5 years)
customer_reviews.text: It is superfast - and so TINY, smaller than a credit card. I bought two, using one for running Windows in Parallels and the other for my Time Machine backup, so far all good. I didn't install the Samsung mac software, I just reformatted both in Mac journaled extended since I'm only connecting to a Mac. I did have some issues at first connecting to my Macbook Air and I stuck the drive on my old windows laptop and reformatted it as NTFS first, then it read properly on my Macbook Air and reformatted in Mac journaled.
customer_reviews.author: texas critter

customer_reviews.title: Handy Backup until became incompatible!
customer_reviews.text: I simply plugged into my Macbook (with included type C cable), and set up password. Now, automatically opens box to put in password and done. (It does have a little quirk that demands you delete setup icon each time it's plugged in, and it gives a warning but doesn't seem to affect operation.) I trust the SSD, it plugs in directly without adapters, it's really fast...what's not to like. *UPDATE 10/19 Was getting stubborn, but when updated to "Catalina", totally incompatible. Support says: Working on it. So I have many GB of vids and photos not lost but frozen. Now I understand the reviewers that recommended reformatting.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Will not install with Windows 10
customer_reviews.text: This drive includes software which must be installed on your PC. This does not operate like a simple thumb drive. After the software was installed my PC would not recognize that the device was connected even though the software was extracted form the device. Waste of time and money.
customer_reviews.author: AJR

customer_reviews.title: It's not too bad.
customer_reviews.text: It's not bad for a portable USB ssd. The only issues I've ran into every now and then is that it sometimes screws up some files. Though it can be easily fixed when scanning for hardware errors, and my files come back. If you are looking for something similar to a USB stick that's faster and holds a lot, get this. If you are looking for something to hold all of your personal, and very important information(also to run windows and what not), just get an ssd that plugs into your motherboard.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Reliable
customer_reviews.text: I have a computer from 2012 that had become painfully slow. Since I am quite frugal and not really in need of a new computer I decided to look into other options. I came across and option of adding a SSD to the computer via USB. Wow what a difference. The computer boots up in a matter of seconds now rather that several minutes. I am also able to use Photoshop, among other programs, that just wouldn't run or the ran to slow to be useful. This SSD has made my old computer run better than it did when it was brand new.
customer_reviews.author: L. E. Geoffroy

customer_reviews.title: Nice size but doesn't work with my phone
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after having a horrible experience with another vendor. I like the size and the form factor, but I mistakenly expected Samsung to have competent support. This SSD does not work with my Google Pixel 3a XL running Android 10. When I contacted Samsung they did no troubleshooting nor did they ask any questions, they just turned around and said it must be a phone problem and to contact the device manufacturer. I am very unhappy - the primary reason I bought this thing was to use it for storage for files on my phone.
customer_reviews.author: Rob A.

customer_reviews.title: 427.7 MB/s read, 409.0 MB/s write, over USB 3.0.
customer_reviews.text: a failing (bad sectors) 1TB hard drive in my iMac14,3 has been causing the OS to run unexpectedly sluggishly. instead of trying to replace the failing internal hard drive which is a lot of work, I'm using an external SSD which just plugs into the USB 3.0 port. the OS runs faster now. Samsung T5 Portable SSD 500GB over USB 3.0: Seq QD32: 427.7 MB/s read, 409.0 MB/s write 4K QD32: 150.6 MB/s read, 25.14 MB/s write Seq: 409.4 MB/s read, 385.0 MB/s write 4K: 29.40 MB/s read, 24.33 MB/s write
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Much faster for Xbox One X
customer_reviews.text: Im using this as an external drive for my Xbox, its very easy to transfer already downloaded games to it and the load times are SIGNIFICANTLY faster for every game Ive tried so far (Forza Horizon 4, Forza Motorsport 7, Black ops 1,2,3,4, Fallout 4, Street Fighter 30 year) with Forza 4 and Fallout 4 being notably large performance boosts. I wish there was some way to load the Xbox operating system on the external drive, then it would also boot much quicker
customer_reviews.author: en sabbah nur

customer_reviews.title: A Great value, whether for the TeslaCam or a Fusion drive on an aging iMac
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these. USB storage in a Tesla for TeslaCam is notoriously finicky. This is the one device that I recommend to others as rock-solid. Not a frame dropped since I've used it. The second one is just beginning life in a Fusion drive for an iMac because the internals are failing and the iMac is a pain to open, with external USB being almost as fast as internal SATA in practice. (5Gb/s vs. 6, with neither device really sustaining that burst speed for long). So far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Fast and small!
customer_reviews.text: The T5 is fast, small, and so far it's been rock solid reliable. It's amazing how fast these external SSDs have gotten. The USB 3.1 Type C helps in that regard, and it has the added benefit of being small, reversible, and ubiquitous with other devices I own. I originally bought a T5 for photos, and after using it for a while I bought another one to use as a backup drive. The only downside is price, but that's coming down over time. I picked up a 256 GB external SSD about 3 years ago for well over $325. I was able to get twice that storage at nearly half the cost today. We live in great times!
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Have used three of these for years now, no problems
customer_reviews.text: I use one of these as the main boot drive for an iMac Retina 27" that we purchased in late 2015. Since it is the boot drive (the internal iMac SSD is unmounted and unused), it must perform at speed, flawlessly, and it does. A second one is used as a clone (using either dd or Carbon Copy Cloner) of that drive as a bootable back up, and a third one is used as a bootable backup for a MacBook Pro. I have experienced no speed issues or glitches, so I am very happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Garth D. Wiebe

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Size and Performance
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to back up all my files and was shocked to see how fast my files could transfer. It comes with a software you can install on your computer or phone which allows you to lock your files. Great functionality, portability, and comes with nice cables. The only thing I would change is the surface finish is a little rough, so when holding the device, it does not feel nice to the touch. Hopefully the t6 or t7 will eventually come out with a better surface finish. I can not imagine buying a storage device from anyone else after experiencing the performance of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Eric C

customer_reviews.title: Terrific portable SSD storage for my iMac!
customer_reviews.text: I had another product for my old 2009 iMac, but saw a youtube review of this SSD storage and thought I'd give it a try with my new 2019 iMac set up to TimeMachine. I had a question about data transfer, and called support; the rep was very helpful and courteous. It's built solidly, the transfer is seamless and fast, and with SSD technology I expect it to last a LONG time. You get what you pay for, and I don't want to risk another data backup loss like I have in the past. I've been super happy with this product and would not hesitate to recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Smart Blonde

customer_reviews.title: Fast and compact SSD drive
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a fast and compact external SSD drive to serve as the boot volume for my iMac. It has a 3 TB external HD which is great to storage, but it's slow to boot. Using the Samsung T5 cut my start-up time by >90% and breathed new life into my iMac. Due to it's compact size (it's barely larger than a credit card) it's almost unnoticeable on my desk. After ~1.5 years of usage I have not had any issues with this SSD and would definitely buy it again if I need another one.
customer_reviews.author: Thor

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Compact SSD for Remote Backups
customer_reviews.text: I run a business and do all the accounting. I have the information on a PC. I backup daily to an external hard drive. I also keep an off site backup on this SSD. I keep it in the glove box of my car. I back it up weekly. If the building burns down all my data is lost on both hard drives, but this one will be fine. It is replacement for a small portable hard drive. SSD can take the temperature fluctuations better and less chance of failing. I've been backing up on it but have yet to use it to restore from. It is encrypted which is another very valuable feature. It is a great failsafe!
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Gabriel

customer_reviews.title: Great for Tesla
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my Model 3 for road trip recording and, of course sentry mode. Super useful on a 3000 mile road trip up and down 101 from Seattle to Big Sur, red woods, Oregon coast and a few other side trips and back. I made a movie from the recorded video. Originally I had some trouble formatting it for use in the car but a software update fixed that. Any way, nice little devise, well made and does the job. I love the USB C to.
customer_reviews.author: DonBeck69

customer_reviews.title: Dead on arrival
customer_reviews.text: Was dead when I recieved it. Troubleshooted with Samsung for hours installing detection softwares and using different cables. Samsung agreed to repair it for free and claimed to send a shipping label to cover the costs. The label never arrived and I've been stuck with a dead SSD for a while now. Ended up buying a Sandisk which works perfectly. Very disappointed in Samsung's quality control and customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: FAST even if you don't have USB-C
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to buy this because my 2015 iMac can only use this drive on old USB-A plug (Sorry; apparently impossible to convert to 'Thunderbolt-2'). "It's only two wires, how could it compete?" It is FIRE! Drop stuff here for practically instant copying. Look at 5 minutes for 50 Gb copy. Unbelievable. I am working with iMovie files from this drive as though it was my main drive. This $100 could save you hecka headaches - better to buy it sooner rather than later.
customer_reviews.author: RTchr

customer_reviews.title: The Storage of Data
customer_reviews.text: Just visited YouTube about the Samsung SSD, saying how the hard drive is used; storing videos on it, that is something new, because hard drive is for storage, that true, but how about using the SSD drive for a system image backup. These days a operating system comes with a hard drive with plenty of space for videos and games, to be save on the hard disk drive and a SSD drive too. Finally, a SSD drive has no moving parts, to throw it off track.
customer_reviews.author: Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Only 465 Gb
customer_reviews.text: It works very well but I have a BIG PROBLEM. It only has 465 Gb. I'm missing 35Gb but I paid for 500. Almost 10% smaller should have an almost 10 % discount. I needed to back up an old 500Gb drive that is full and I won't be able to completely do it because, unlike this one, the other one is even a bit more than 500Gb.
customer_reviews.author: MN

customer_reviews.title: Compact and works fine so far
customer_reviews.text: I needed a replacement for my WD onsite backup which stopped working (and I cannot actually use anymore for back ups or to get the info from it). I read the good reviews for this item and I decided to tried it. The only problem is that is a (very expensive) simple storage gadget, so I haven't figured out yet how to schedule automatic backups. What I am doing is to copy the important files there, updating them one in a while, which is far from ideal. That's why I haven't rated it 5 *.
customer_reviews.author: Lourdes

customer_reviews.title: Very impressive; 500 GB nominal, 465 available.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the case, so if I had it disconnected, I could find it easier on my cluttered desk. I installed this on two computers with no difficulty. I copied the documents directory and the pictures directory from the C: drive to this SSD and those took just seconds for the file transfers. I bought this for installing Linus and accessories, so I will soon see how that goes. I understand Linus installs on a flash drive, so this is my flash drive for those purposes. I expected quality from a Samsung product, and so far it seems to be true.
customer_reviews.author: Rick L

customer_reviews.title: Sentry Mode in a Tesla
customer_reviews.text: Used for my Tesla Model 3 Sentry Mode recording along with storing music for the car. This works perfect for this application.
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: Like an New Computer
customer_reviews.text: I wish I did this a long time ago. I added this to my 2013 21" iMac as a clone so my Mac would run off of the SSD rather than the internal HD. My Mac screams in speed now compared to the other internal HD. Like I said, I wish and would've done this a while ago. I've been running my Mac off this SSD for over a month now and it has been seamless and makes me feel like I was running off of a dial up modem before. I'm also running Apple's latest OS Catalina without any problem.
customer_reviews.author: R. LoScalzo

customer_reviews.title: Slow loading speed.
customer_reviews.text: Loading PUBG on XBOX ONE S with this SSD is the same speed as using XBOX ONE S INTERNAL HDD...no improvement! Compared with other games...same thing. Tried connecting SSD to each of the 3 USB ports on XBOX ONE S.....same results. The only fast speed is when copying/moving games from XBOX ONE S HDD over to this 500gb SSD ...60% faster. So, the faster speed worked only for installing but not LOADING/PLAYING games on SSD. Ok for backup memory for extra game storage but not effective for playing games from it...same loading speed as internal hdd of XBOX ONE S.
customer_reviews.author: Hawaii Customer

customer_reviews.title: Samsung SSD is solid and some tips to consider...
customer_reviews.text: What a good bargain for $97! For its been good especially when I allocated this SSD for my vmware workstation with "Page Fault In Nonpaged Area'" BSOD. No corruption of SSD. Wait for Black Friday or Cyber Monday for good deals. Some basic tips for new SSD owners: 1. Do Not Fill it Full Capacity - or life your SSD will shortly greatly as well as your write speed over time 2. DO NOT DEFRAG or failure of SSD is immient. Also, when you plug this into your computer - Actual file capacity is 465 GB out of 465 GB - No data used or loss - normal starting capacity
customer_reviews.author: M.L.

customer_reviews.title: Fast! Faster! Fastest!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent SSD and very fast. I did not use their software. Has worked perfectly so far and I am getting 186-220 MB/s on old USB 3.0 sustained (average 186-188) which is faster than any other drive I've used on this particular system. Very small. Doesn't even get warm in use from what I've seen. Pretty good price as well. Liked it so much, I just ordered a second one. Kudos to Samsung for including BOTH cables you might need. That's happening less and less these days and another reason why I am very happy with this drive. Update: Love these drives! Just ordered my third one. So fast and working great so far!
customer_reviews.author: Bron

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what you need for video editing on the go
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use as an external HD to hold GoPro video to edit with Final Cut Pro on my MacBook. The video eats up the limited hard drive space on the computer pretty quickly, so I wanted something small enough to travel with that would allow me to start editing videos during downtime on long trips. This is perfect for that. It's fast enough that I don't notice any performance difference between using it and editing video straight from the computer's internal hard drive.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Herman

customer_reviews.title: Quick and reliable
customer_reviews.text: This SSD is very compact, bus-powered, and runs around 480-520 MBPS. I use it for sample libraries, and when using with a Mac, you MUST format to Mac using the utility. I believe it's a journaled-extended format. If you don't format when using a Mac you will see drastically reduced speeds (closer to 120 MBPS). So far, I've been using it quite a bit and haven't had a single hiccup aside from the formatting thing.
customer_reviews.author: Nic

customer_reviews.title: The best of the best!
customer_reviews.text: Samsung has always been one of the top, premiere SSD manufacturers and it shows in spades with this gorgeous external SSD, the 500GB T5! Exquisite build, design, color and performance there aren't many drives out today that check all of those boxes! I'm hitting advertised speeds regularly via USB-C to Thunderbolt 3 on my Dell XPS 12 9250! Again, not many can claim that. Got it on sale for a great price and I'm 200% satisfied with the purchase! Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Troy L.

customer_reviews.title: I came back for 2nd's.
customer_reviews.text: These results are from using USB 3.0, however this device is capable of using USB 3.1 which will likely result in transfer speeds topping out around 540mbps. Very compact and easy to use. Come with Two different cables. I still have my first drive that I have used daily for the past two years, never A problem with it.
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful little ssd.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this for my ps4 as an external expanded memory. It works great and is rather quick for digital games. It's been a nice addition and makes loading games much quicker than off the HDD. The size of the unit is rather small and cute. Smaller than a guy's common wallet and very light weight. I don't travel with it, because it is attached to my ps4 all the time, but I would say that it has a great potential in that area, especially for a tiny laptop or even a tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Mirage

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my MacBook Pro 2017 with USB-C
customer_reviews.text: With a huge price premium for SSD storage on Apple machines now, I decided to buy this Samsung drive. It's perfect for taking around with me to offload downloaded files on the road. It's 500Gb, so bags of space, and it's super light like a couple of coins in your pocket. I'm a tutor so there are loads of files for lessons, including video and games, that I need to carry so now it doesn't all need to sit in the computer, it's in the SSD and ready to be used instantly. With USB-C to connect to the MacBook Pro it is so fast it feels like an internal drive. I love this little gadget.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. Compact size for amount of data
customer_reviews.text: As described. Very compact. This SSD is replacing a failed 3 yr old Seagate HDD. NOTE old seagate Hdd is up to $650 in attempted recovery costs and no data recovered thus far. Transitioning away from mechanical hdd devices and to ssd. Can’t tell you if it too will fail 3-5 years down the road. Bought the 3 year recovery plan to go along with it. Using as backup to cloud now
customer_reviews.author: helen l. deitriech

customer_reviews.title: not good as old model from T5
customer_reviews.text: this one have a weird behave, when I transfer the file to the T5 drive the speed sometime the speed goes to from 200 mb/s to 0 mb/s and the only way to make the drive return to the natural condition, is to unplug it from my laptop and connect it again. it happen many times to the annoying point.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonSky

customer_reviews.title: 4.5 Stars
customer_reviews.text: A gift for friend. My friend said it is fast. Simultaneously, I purchased another one for myself. Different computers can have different copying in/out speed. Just for reference Mine peak speed was 170-180MB/s. Lowest speed is 75MB/S. I was copying small files(pictures) into this SSD from my laptop. My device is win10.My laptop's CPU was Intel 7th Core i5. I am ok with this speed. The device is like 1/3 size of my big phone. Easy for carry. I need rate down the shipping This SSD was sent to my neighbor crossing over the street! Luckily I got it. I hope I can give feedback for shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron.C

customer_reviews.title: A must have for traveling
customer_reviews.text: I travel a lot and take lots of pictures using both full-frame mirrorless and drones. I accumulate about 80gig worth of pictures and videos in one day. When I am back at the hotel, I need a harddrive that is fast and as portable as possible and this T5 SSD is perfect. Fast transferring rate and extremely portable (fits right into your palm). Will definitely buy more and upgrade it to the 1TB and/or 2TB when they are on sale.
customer_reviews.author: JLong

customer_reviews.title: Issues with disk space
customer_reviews.text: When I tried using this I could install the software and everything fine, but I can’t store a single thing on the drive itself. I tried moving a single word document to it and it said I didn’t have enough space. I tried reformatting it and I have the same issue. I watched videos on this specific drive and everything I try that works for them doesn’t work for me.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: I found setting this device up on a Mac was quite confusing and cumbersome
customer_reviews.text: Basically, the "How to setup" part needs a lot of work. It was very confusing. No meaningful help came with the device, and I never successfully found any on the Samsung web site. I also found seeing an app downloaded onto my machine without notice somewhat alarming. But it's working. The ads all push it as Apple compatible, but I began to feel that was a stretch too far. In my own defense, I've worked with computer technology for over 40 years, and this should have been a lot easier.
customer_reviews.author: Carl C.

customer_reviews.title: ...of course, the price drops $6.78 a week after I buy it.
customer_reviews.text: I use it as a backup drive for my wife's computer it's small enough to lay on the speaker area at the top of the keyboard area. 500 GB is enough to keep two weeks of full backups follow by 6 differentials w/o using much more than half the drive space. The the third week it writes over the older set. That way you don't wear the drive out by doing most of your read/writes in a smaller area... I've had it a week and works great, so far...
customer_reviews.author: Strnj1

customer_reviews.title: Best for Tesla cam
customer_reviews.text: After reading reviews got this drive for my Model 3. Works great after formatting. Not any issues as long as I keep plugged into the left port. Also have Taptes charger and splitter so made sure it was still plugged into the left.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Ssd w usb 3 is faster!
customer_reviews.text: IT guy but the specs are only so important. I needed performance and this little thing delivers. I used it for a data dump for a client because it was faster than his downloading/upload abilities. Now I just use it on my XBox and it speeds up loading times dramatically! Best bang for the buck and worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Brian W

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with macOS Catalina
customer_reviews.text: There have been reports of the encryption software not working with Catalina since early 2019, it is now almost November and anyone who updated to Catalina cannot use their drive.
customer_reviews.author: Kingsley

product_meta.title: SAMSUNG T5 Portable SSD 500GB - Up to 540MB/s - USB 3.1 External Solid State Drive, Black (MU-PA500B/AM)
product_meta.description: The Samsung T5 Portable SSD has the latest in Samsung V-NAND flash memory technology. Its portable design, blazing fast transfer speeds of up to 540 MB/s, shock resistance, and secure encryption make it the best portable SSD on the market. Shockproof aluminum exterior-can withstand accidental drops of up to 2m.
feature_bullets: Superfast read write speeds: SSD with V-NAND offers ultra-fast data transfer speeds of up to 540MB/s (up to 4.9x faster than external HDDs); Ideal for transferring large-sized data including 4K videos, high-resolution photos, games and more
Compact and portable design: Top to bottom shock resistant metal design fits in the palm of your hand and easily slides in your pocket or purse to take work and entertainment on the go
Secure encryption: Optional password protection and AES 256-bit hardware encryption keeps your personal and private data more secure
Seamless connectivity: Includes USB type C to C and USB type C to A cables to connect to PCs, Macs, smartphones and other devices

Warranty and compatibility: 3-year limited warranty; Requires Windows 7, Mac OS X 10.9 (Mavericks), Android 4.4 (KitKat), or higher; Older versions of the Windows, Mac and Android operating systems may not be supported

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars4,479 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
